html: As at Israel’s ancient Passover (Exodus 12), Jehovah’s covenant people are to “hide” in their habitations until his wrath is past—until the king of Assyria/Babylon’s work of punishing the wicked blows over and he is punished himself. While Jehovah intervenes to protect his elect who participate in a new exodus to (cf. Isaiah 43:2, 5–6, 16–17; 48:20–21; 52:11–12), he protects indirectly those who don’t sufficiently repent to qualify for the new exodus. On resurrection morning—at Jehovah’s coming to reign—the earth’s “slain” (hǎrûgêhā), too, awake to a glorious new age (cf. v 19).
